result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Everett Poole

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Everett Poole not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for James Everett Poole.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests resolution date.
Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant James Everett Poole not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for James Everett Poole.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Due to defendant being in custody, Court waives defendant's appearance.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant James Everett Poole appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert W Peterson appeared by video for James Everett Poole.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Melissa E.J. (victim), DH-W (Co-actor, DOB 12-04-2006)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
